climbs.name: Unmitigated Damages
climbs.fa: Scott Cosgrove, Direct Start: Scott Cosgrove

content.description:
This is the prominent wide crack on the right side of the east face. A direct start has been done on top-rope and is rated 5.12c.

Previously listed in guidebooks as O.W.

climbs.name: Todd Couple, The
climbs.fa: Todd Swain and Peggy Buckey, April 1991

content.description: a short climb with a really fun crux large overhang
content.protection: standard rack, with small pieces for the crux
content.location: At the left end of the east face of the rock.

content.description:
Up a left-leaning crack system with many jugs to a high shoulder ledge, then straight up additional lower angled cracks to the top where

Skinny Legs And All

also finishes.
content.protection:
Pro to 2.5", gear anchor. Descend by tunneling through to climber's right, then scramble down the boulder talus further to the right and touch down at the toe of the SW corner. Also possible to scramble across the top to the backside bolted rap anchor atop

The Confessional

.
content.location:
SW corner of Micro Crag, about 30 ft right of

Skinny Legs And All

.

climbs.name: Snicker Biscuit
climbs.fa: Robert Hynes, Feb. 1989 (TR), Todd Swain April 1991 (FFA)

content.description:
In the middle of the steepest section of the Micro Crag are two steep cracks.  Begin on a ramp right of the direct line and cross into the initial crack.  Move to and finish on the left crack as it opens up.  A direct start looks like it can be done (as marked in Vogel's guide), but would be unprotected.

This climb is steep and powerful throughout.  The rock is still "developing".  High up a large foothold disintegrated beneath me, nearly braining my belayer. A key handhold seems slightly suspect.  Nonetheless, a worthwhile climb in an area spotted with worthy ticks.
content.protection: Standard rack, small nuts or brass protect the crux.  Descend to the climbers left.

climbs.name: Wired
climbs.fa: Alan Roberts, Don Reid & Bob Harrington 1985

content.description: Just left of Snicker Biscuit. Look for the column of rock that marks the start of the route. Fun liebacking to a grainy hand crack at the top. Interesting pro can be had by slinging the detached column near the base of the route.Short route but fun.
content.protection:
Pro: very thin to 2 inches

Anchor: 2-3" pieces , cordelette , runners to extend. Solid crack up top for bomber natural anchor. Extension useful to minimize drag.

content.description:
Though this dihedral looks pretty uninspiring from below, it is actually better and harder than it looks. Well worth a go when you're in the area.

Descent: rap from a bolted anchor at the top of The Confessional on the east side of Micro Crag.
content.location: On the back (west) side of the rock. Look for the obvious dihedral. The bush mentioned in some guidebooks is barely visible in the upper part of the route.

content.description: Just to the right of the leftmost dihedral on the west side, it follows the series of corners and passes a few bushes.

Up to and over a left-slanting roof crack, then easy terrain to the top. Walk off to climber's right, or across the top to the backside rap anchor atop

The Confessional

.
No distinct crux.  Starts up a slab and takes a series of obvious varnished hand cracks that slant one way and then the other.  Protects well.
content.protection: Gear to 2".  Thin nuts are useful if desired.
content.location: On the middle of the low angle west face.

climbs.name: Confessional
climbs.fa: Robert Hynes and Dave Wonderly, January 1989

content.description: Climb the left-facing corner, passing a ledge,  to the right of  "The Todd Couple".
